Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no evidence that the alleged shooter is an activist in the Black Lives Matter movement and was not wearing a Breonna Taylor T-shirt.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that a BLM activist killed three people in a Louisville bar wearing a Breonna Taylor T-shirt when there is no evidence to support this.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence to back up the assertion that the alleged shooter is a BLM activist wearing a Breonna Taylor T-shirt.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the alleged shooter is a BLM activist and was wearing a Breonna Taylor T-shirt, even though there is no evidence to support this.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the shooting was a "completely random act" according to the police.
